required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Cladribine Tablets in Participants With Highly-active Relapsing Multiple Sclerosis (CAMELOT-MS)
clinical_study.official_title: Cladribine Tablets in Highly-active Relapsing Multiple Sclerosis - Real-World Effectiveness in UK Clinical Practice (CAMELOT-MS)

lead_sponsor.agency: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

collaborator.agency: Merck Serono Limited, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

clinical_study.source: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to investigate the effectiveness of cladribine tablets in a UK real-world setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year Prior to Treatment Initiation With Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 Year prior to date of Cladribine tablet initiation
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in the year prior to the date of Cladribine tablet initiation.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year 1 After Treatment Initiation With Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 1 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in Year 1 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year 2 After Treatment Initiation with Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 2 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in Years 2 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year 3 After Treatment Initiation with Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 3 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in Year 3 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year 4 After Treatment Initiation with Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 4 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in Years 4 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets.

primary_outcome.measure: Annualized Relapse Rate in the Year 5 After Treatment Initiation with Cladribine Tablets
primary_outcome.time_frame: Year 5 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets
primary_outcome.description: The annualized relapse rate for a participant is defined here as the number of clinician's confirmed relapses that occurred in Year 5 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Remain Relapse-Free in Each Year after Initiation of Cladribine Tablet Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Year 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Remain Relapse-free up to 5 years After the Initation of Caldribine Tablets
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after the initation of Cladribine tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from Cladribine Tablet Initiation to First Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to maximum 5 years after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued Cladribine Tablets
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Cladribine treatment initiation up to end of Cladribine treatment (assessed up end of Treatment Year 2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Received Subsequent Disease-modifying Therapies (DMTs) after Cladribine Tablets Discontinuation/Treatment Completion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Disability Progression Assessed by Expanded Disease Severity Scale (EDSS) at Treatment Initiation and Start of Treatment Year 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Treatment Initiation and Start of Treatment Year 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Disability Progression Confirmed over 6 Months, Assessed by Expanded Disease Severity Scale (EDSS) at 2 Years after Cladribine Tablet Treatment Initiation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 2 years after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Grade 3 Lymphopenia, Grade 4 Lymphopenia, Herpes Infections, Serious Infections, Opportunistic Infections and Malignancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to maximum 5 years after treatment initiation with Cladribine tablets

arm_group.description: No intervention will be administered as a part of this study. Participants with Highly-active Disease Relapsing-remitting Multiple Sclerosis (HDA-RRMS), who completed at least Year 1 of treatment with cladribine tablets in routine clinical practice will be enrolled into this study and assessed up to maximum 5 years after cladribine tablets initiation.

study_pop.textblock: Participants with HDA-RRMS who initiated treatment with cladribine tablets.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Physician diagnosis of HDA-RRMS as defined by clinical or radiological features
- Treatment initiation with cladribine tablet monotherapy on or after 22 August 2017 and at least 3 years before enrolment
- Completion of Year 1 treatment of cladribine tablets (Week 1 and Week 2 treatment, per recommended dose in Year 1: 1.75 milligrams per kilogram [mg/kg] body weight, cumulatively)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received cladribine tablet treatment within an interventional clinical trial during the study period
- Received treatment with any investigational therapy for RRMS in the 6 months prior to cladribine tablet treatment initiation
